ETYMOLOGY: From Old English 'lim' (joint, limb of the body), related to Old Norse 'limr' (limb, branch) and Old High German 'lim' (twig). The 'b' was added later, likely by analogy with words like 'thumb' or 'numb', but remains silent.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A noun is a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these. Countable nouns have both singular and plural forms.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: An arm or leg of a person or animal, or a wing or fin of an animal.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 人或动物的四肢（如手臂、腿），或动物的翅膀、鳍。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The doctor checked for injuries to her limbs after the fall.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 跌倒后，医生检查了她的四肢是否受伤。

MEANINGS.PATTERN: a limb | limb of a tree
MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A noun is a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these. Countable nouns have both singular and plural forms.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A large branch of a tree.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Squirrels often run along the limbs of the old oak tree.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 松鼠经常沿着老橡树的树枝跑动。

MEANINGS.PATTERN: on a limb | out on a limb
MEANINGS.POS_TIP: An idiom is a group of words established by usage as having a meaning not deducible from those of the individual words.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: In a dangerous, exposed, or isolated position; taking a risk.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 处于危险、孤立或易受攻击的境地；冒险。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He went out on a limb to support his unpopular opinion.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他冒着风险支持他不受欢迎的观点。
